name: beauty
content:
beauty

noun
 
 
/ˈbjuːti/
 
/ˈbjuːti/
(plural beauties)
Idioms
jump to other results
  1.  
     [uncountable] the quality of giving pleasure to the senses or to the mind
    • beauty of something the beauty of the sunset/of poetry/of his singing
    • The woods were designated an area of outstanding natural beauty.
    • beauty products/treatments (= intended to make a person more beautiful)
    • She was a contestant in the Miss World beauty pageant.
    • His voice is a thing of beauty.
    • The sheer beauty of the scenery took my breath away.
    • a woman of great beauty
    Extra Examples
    • Her beauty faded as she got older.
    • He admired the classical beauty of her face.
    • The beauty of the city amazed her.
    • They took a walk, enjoying the beauty of the landscape.
    • We all admired the beauty of the sunset.
    • The film-maker magnificently captures the beauty of the changing seasons.
    • Enjoy the timeless beauty of this ancient landscape.
    • They were captivated by the ethereal beauty of the music.
    • There is a stark beauty to the desert terrain.
    • It's an area of breathtaking beauty.
    • Her art challenges conventions of feminine beauty.
    • The film argues that inner beauty, not physical appearance, is most important.
    • She works in a beauty salon.
    • We stock a wide range of beauty products.
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryadjective
    • breathtaking
    • exquisite
    • great
    • …
    verb + beauty
    • admire
    • appreciate
    • enjoy
    • …
    beauty + verb
    • amaze somebody
    • overwhelm somebody
    • last
    • …
    beauty + noun
    • competition
    • contest
    • pageant
    • …
    See full entry
  2. [countable] a person or thing that is beautiful
    • She had been a beauty in her day.
    • Isn't she a little beauty?
    • She was known as a great beauty in her time.
    • She was still a radiant beauty.
    • She was an exotic beauty with raven hair.
    Topics Appearanceb2
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryadjective
    • great
    • blonde
    • dark-haired
    • …
    See full entry
  3. [countable] an excellent example of its type
    • That last goal was a beauty!
    • My new car's a real beauty!
  4. [countable] an attractive feature synonym advantage
    • One of the beauties of living here is that it's so peaceful.
    • The project will require very little work to start up; that's the beauty of it.
    5. Word OriginMiddle English: from Old French beaute, based on Latin bellus ‘beautiful, fine’.
Idioms
beauty is in the eye of the beholder
  1. (saying) people all have different ideas about what is beautiful
beauty is only skin-deep
  1. (saying) how a person looks is less important than their character
See beauty in the Oxford Advanced American DictionarySee beauty in the Oxford Learner's Dictionary of Academic English
Check pronunciation: beauty
matches: Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty noun
relatives: Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty noun

name: beauty mark
content:
beauty mark

noun
 
/ˈbjuːti mɑːk/
 
/ˈbjuːti mɑːrk/
(North American English)
(also beauty spot British and North American English)
jump to other results
  1. a small dark spot on a woman’s face, which used to be thought to make her more beautiful
See beauty mark in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: beauty mark

name: beauty spot
content:
beauty spot

noun
 
/ˈbjuːti spɒt/
 
/ˈbjuːti spɑːt/
jump to other results
  1. (British English) a place in the countryside which is famous because it is beautiful
    • The lake is one of the local beauty spots.
  2. (North American English also beauty mark)
     a small dark spot on a woman’s face, which used to be thought to make her more beautiful
    • She had a small beauty spot on the left side of her face.
See beauty spot in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: beauty spot

name: beauty queen
content:
beauty queen

noun
 
/ˈbjuːti kwiːn/
 
/ˈbjuːti kwiːn/
jump to other results
  1. a woman who is judged to be the most beautiful in a beauty contest
See beauty queen in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: beauty queen

name: beauty salon
content:
beauty salon

noun
 
/ˈbjuːti sælɒn/
 
/ˈbjuːti səlɑːn/
(also beauty parlour)
(US English also beauty shop)
jump to other results
  1. a place where you can pay for treatment to your face, hair, nails, etc., which is intended to make you more beautifulTopics Appearancec1
See beauty salon in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: beauty salon

name: beauty school
content:
beauty school

noun
 
/ˈbjuːti skuːl/
 
/ˈbjuːti skuːl/
 (North American English)
jump to other results
  1. a place that trains people to cut hair, take care of nails, etc. as a job
    • She’s going to beauty school to become a hair stylist.
    Topics Appearancec2
See beauty school in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: beauty school

name: beauty sleep
content:
beauty sleep

noun
 
/ˈbjuːti sliːp/
 
/ˈbjuːti sliːp/
 [uncountable] (humorous)
jump to other results
  1. enough sleep at night to make sure that you look and feel healthy and beautifulTopics Health and Fitnessc2
See beauty sleep in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: beauty sleep

name: Black Beauty
content:
Black Beauty

 
/ˌblæk ˈbjuːti/
 
/ˌblæk ˈbjuːti/
jump to other results
  1. a black horse which is the main character in a novel (1877) of the same name written for children by Anna Sewell (1820-78). The story is about the horse's experiences with a series of different owners. There have been several films and television programmes made of it.
Check pronunciation: Black Beauty

name: beauty contest
content:
beauty contest

noun
 
/ˈbjuːti kɒntest/
 
/ˈbjuːti kɑːntest/
(British English)
jump to other results
  1. a competition to choose the most beautiful from a group of women compare pageant
  2. (US English beauty parade)
     an occasion on which several competing companies or people try to persuade somebody to use their services
    • Ireland is to award four telecommunications licences in a beauty contest next year.
    • The licence to operate the Digital Terrestrial Television retail company will be awarded via a hybrid of an auction and a beauty parade.
See beauty contest in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: beauty contest

name: Sleeping Beauty
content:
Sleeping Beauty

noun
 
/ˌsliːpɪŋ ˈbjuːti/
 
/ˌsliːpɪŋ ˈbjuːti/
jump to other results
  1. The Sleeping Beauty
     a traditional children's story about a princess who falls asleep and cannot wake up because a witch (= a woman with evil magic powers) has put a spell (= a condition caused by magic) on her. A hundred years later, a prince finds her and kisses her. The kiss breaks the spell and she wakes up. The story is often used in British pantomimes.
  2. used to refer to somebody who has been asleep for a long time
    • OK, Sleeping Beauty, time to get up.
    More Like This Expressions from history and legendExpressions from history and legend
    • Achilles heel
    • Cinderella
    • Herculean
    • Mephistophelian
    • Midas touch
    • narcissism
    • odyssey
    • Prince Charming
    • Procrustean
    • Promethean
    • Pyrrhic
    • Robin Hood
    • Scylla and Charybdis
    • Sleeping Beauty
    • Stygian
    • Titan
See Sleeping Beauty in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: Sleeping Beauty

name: Beauty and the Beast
content:
Beauty and the Beast

noun
 
/ˌbjuːti ən ðə ˈbiːst/
 
/ˌbjuːti ən ðə ˈbiːst/
jump to other results
  1. a traditional story about a young girl who saves a large ugly creature from a magic spell by her love. He becomes a handsome prince and they get married.
  2. (informal, humorous) two people of whom one is much more attractive than the other
See Beauty and the Beast in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: Beauty and the Beast

name: Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty
content:
Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty

noun
 
/ˌeəriə əv aʊtˌstændɪŋ ˌnætʃrəl ˈbjuːti/
 
/ˌeriə əv aʊtˌstændɪŋ ˌnætʃrəl ˈbjuːti/
(abbreviation AONB)
jump to other results
  1. an area of countryside in the UK that is protected because of its landscape or because it has important historical or cultural connections. Similar areas in Scotland are called national scenic areas.
Check pronunciation: Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty
nearBys: Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty noun
